snippet: In elegant Manhattan apartment buildings, servants’ rooms once occupied a now-coveted location: the top floor.
abstract: The Appraisal column; sparse servants quarters still exist on top floors of a handful of Manhattan's luxury buildings, but most have been gutted or collapsed into penthouses or large apartments; until penthouse living became popular in the 1920s, it was common to house servants on the top floor, now considered its most desirable location.
lead_paragraph: In elegant Manhattan apartment buildings, servants’ rooms once occupied a now-coveted location: the top floor.

headline.seo: An Apartment High Above 5th Avenue, but Without Frills
headline.main: Lofty Perches Whose Only Luxury Was the View
headline.print_headline: Lofty Perches Whose Only Luxury Was a Majestic View
